Title: Silence of the Lambs
Description: A young FBI cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Jonathan Demme
Director.Bio: Robert Jonathan Demme was an American director, producer, and screenwriter.

Title: The Lake House
Description: The story of a romance that spans years but involves only a few kisses. It succeeds despite being based on two paradoxes: time travel, and the ability of two people to have conversations that are, under the terms established by the film, impossible.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Alejandro Agresti
Director.Bio: Alejandro Agresti is an Argentine film director, writer and producer. A prominent filmmaker in his country.

Title: The HEAT
Desctiption: An uptight FBI Special Agent is paired with a foul-mouthed Boston cop to take down a ruthless drug lord.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on humor. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often work by exaggrating characteristics for humorous effect.

Director.Name: Paul Feig
Director.Bio: Paul Samuel Feig is an American actor and filmmaker. He is known for directing films starring frequent collaborator Melissa McCarthy.

Title: SPY
Decsription: A desk-bound CIA analyst volunteers to go undercover to infiltrate the world of a deadly arms dealer, and prevent diabolical global disaster.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on humor. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often work by exaggrating characteristics for humorous effect.

Director.Name: Paul Feig
Director.Bio: Paul Samuel Feig is an American actor and filmmaker. He is known for directing films starring frequent collaborator Melissa McCarthy.

Title: The Bourne Identity
Description: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action is a genre in which the protagonist or protagonists are thrust into a series of events that typically include violence extended fighting, physical feats, rescues and frantic chases.

Director.Name: Doug Liman
Director.Bio: Douglas Eric Liman is an American film director and producer. He is known for directing the films Swingers, Go, The Bourne Identity, Mr. & Mrs. Smith, Jumper, Edge of Tomorrow, and American Made.

Title: The Devil Wears Prada
Description: In New York, the simple and naive just-graduated in journalism Andrea Sachs is hired to work as the second assistant of the powerful and sophisticated Miranda Priestly, the ruthless and merciless executive of the Runway fashion magazine. Andrea dreams to become a journalist and faces the opportunity as a temporary professional challenge. The first assistant Emily advises Andrea about the behavior and preferences of their cruel boss, and the stylist Nigel helps Andrea to dress more adequately for the environment. Andrea changes her attitude and behavior, affecting her private life and the relationship with her boyfriend Nate, her family and friends. In the end, Andrea learns that life is made of choices.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on humor. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often work by exaggrating characteristics for humorous effect.

Director.Name: David Frankel
Director.Bio: David Frankel is an American film director, screenwriter and producer.

Title: Secondhand Lions
Description: A coming-of-age story about a shy, young boy sent by his irresponsible mother to spend the summer with his wealthy, eccentric uncles in Texas.

Genre.Name: Comedy
Genre.Description: Comedy is a genre of film in which the main emphasis is on humor. These films are designed to make the audience laugh through amusement and most often work by exaggrating characteristics for humorous effect.

Director.Name: Tim McCanlies
Director.Bio: Tim McCanlies is a film director and screenwriter. He is best known for writing and directing Secondhand Lions, and for writing screenplay for The Iron Giant, Born in 1953.

Title: Les Miserables
Descriptions: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

Genre.Name: Musical
Genre.Description: Musical film is a film genre in which songs by the characters are interwoven into the narrative, sometimes accompanied by dancing.

Director.Name: Tom Hopper
Director.Bio: Thomas George Hooper is a British-Australian film and television director and producer.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Descriprion: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy is a genre of film with fantastic themes, usually magic, supernatural events, mythology, folklore, or exotic fantasy worlds. The genre is considered a form of speculative fiction alongside science fiction films and horror films, although genres do overlap.

Director.Name: Peter Jackson
Director.Bio: Peter Jackson, in full Sir Peter Robert Jackson, New Zealand director, perhaps best known for his film adaptations of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
Description: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy is a genre of film with fantastic themes, usually magic, supernatural events, mythology, folklore, or exotic fantasy worlds. The genre is considered a form of speculative fiction alongside science fiction films and horror films, although genres do overlap.

Director.Name: Peter Jackson
Director.Bio: Peter Jackson,in full Sir Peter Robert Jackson, New Zealand director, perhaps best known for his film adaptations of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit.
